title: Why is it possible for me to buy two pairs of boots?
body:
I mean if I buy talisman of the Ascension, the game actively blocks me from buying spellthief edge. Pretty sure its the same with the machete based stuff, yet once I get say a ninja tabi, I am free to buy another pair of moba boots.

Isn't there some easy way to make this impossible seeing as there are only two instances where somebody would do this: Accidentally, or trolling?

They have tried to make the support gold-generation items and jungle items very cost efficient; they don't want you to buy more than one.

They don't care about doing the same for boots, since the MS doesn't stack.

Most Champions have 2 feet. You need a Shoe (or Boot) for each foot or else your champion will hobble around awkwardly and be very uncomfortable which will lead to missing their skillshots. {{champion:115}}

it makes perfect sense too.

Because a lot of boots have generally useful passives... Sure, not enough to warrant buying multiple boots, but there were times where I kept my early/mid game BoM and bought Mecury treads later because I needed the tenacity.
Ultimately, I will sell BoM then again, but not necessarily right away.
The short version is: Because while it's not an optimal strategy, it's not completely wasted and is also not overpowered.

Gp5 and jungle items are limited for balance reasons, more than anything else; and the reason you can't buy multiple basic boots is because the second pair literally gives you no stats at all. (Why you can buy basic boots and upgraded boots is probably a technical reason, since you couldn't buy another pair of upgraded boots without buying the basic first).
